Description: Base of rounded bowl, painted underglaze in black with goose on ground of peony-leaves and six-petalled florets enhanced with blue. Made of heavily potted fritty earthenware; also white. "Pseudo-Sultanabad" wares.
Bibliographic references: Wallis 1891 / Persian Ceramic Art Belonging to Mr F DuCane Godman, FRS: The Thirteenth Century Lustred Vases (Appendix pl.vii.2)
